testsuite.name: 51 - I can use barcodes column in a group all protocol

testcase.name: 51 - I can use barcodes column in a group all protocol LM-51-1 Should show barcode in header when all samples have the same barcode
testcase.classname: LM-51-1 Should show barcode in header when all samples have the same barcode

testcase.name: 51 - I can use barcodes column in a group all protocol LM-51-2 Should say multiple barcodes in header when samples have different barcodes
testcase.classname: LM-51-2 Should say multiple barcodes in header when samples have different barcodes

testcase.name: 51 - I can use barcodes column in a group all protocol LM-51-3 Should say multiple barcodes in header when samples have missing barcodes
testcase.classname: LM-51-3 Should say multiple barcodes in header when samples have missing barcodes

failure.message: Timed out retrying: cy.click() failed because this element is detached from the DOM. ... Cypress requires elements be attached in the DOM to interact with them. The previous command that ran was: > cy.get() This DOM element likely became detached somewhere between the previous and current command. Common situations why this happens: - Your JS framework re-rendered asynchronously - Your app code reacted to an event firing and removed the element You typically need to re-query for the element or add 'guards' which delay Cypress from running new commands. https://on.cypress.io/element-has-detached-from-dom

testcase.name: 51 - I can use barcodes column in a group all protocol LM-51-4 Should have empty header when no samples have barcode
